step: To make the soup base, add the vegetable broth, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, Sichuan peppercorns, and salt to a large pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

While the soup base is simmering, prepare the hot pot ingredients. Cut the vegetables into bite-sized pieces, slice the tofu, and cook the noodles according to package instructions. Prepare the dipping sauces in small bowls and set aside.
Once the soup base is ready, transfer it to a hot pot set or a large pot with a burner. Place it in the center of the dining table and turn the heat to medium.

Allow the soup base to come to a simmer, then start adding the hot pot ingredients to the pot. Cook the vegetables and tofu for a few minutes until they are tender, then remove them with a slotted spoon and dip them in the sauces.
Continue adding more ingredients to the pot as desired, and adjust the heat as necessary to maintain a simmer.
Once all of the ingredients have been cooked and enjoyed, turn off the heat and discard any remaining soup. Clean the pot and store it for future use.
